data.title: White House State visit of Mohammad Reza Pahlavi, also known as Mohammad Reza Shah, was the last Shah of Iran from 16 September 1941 until his overthrow in the Iranian Revolution on 11 February 1979
data.meta_description: A black-and-white photograph of President Jimmy Carter speaking at a podium. The man next to him is wiping his eyes and a crowd is gathered in the background. The photograph is attached to a thick mounting board. The board is stamped on the back.
data.meta_site_name: National Museum of African American History and Culture

Photograph by

Subject of

President Carter, Jimmy, American, born 1924

Carter, Rosalynn, American, born 1927

Pahlavi, Mohammad Reza Shah, Iranian, 1919 - 1980

Unidentified Man or Men

Unidentified Woman or Women

Medium

silver and photographic gelatin on photographic paper, mounting board

Dimensions

H x W (Image and Sheet): 7 7/8 x 9 11/16 in. (20 x 24.6 cm)

Description

A black-and-white photograph of President Jimmy Carter speaking at a podium. The man next to him is wiping his eyes and a crowd is gathered in the background. The photograph is attached to a thick mounting board. The board is stamped on the back.

Place captured

Washington, District of Columbia, United States, North and Central America

Photographs and Still Images

gelatin silver prints
